website_summaries.verdict: Best for homes without metal pipes, this pager system has a range of 150 feet and comes with 2 call buttons in case one gets misplaced.
pros: Comes with 2 call buttons and one caregiver pager
Pager can be carried in pocket or clipped to belt
Batteries included: Call buttons use 2 12-volt batteries
Call buttons come with a lanyard
Large buttons easy to see and hard to lose
cons: Metal pipes can cause interference with the pager system, so consider this when ordering
May not work as well in 2-story houses

customer_reviews.title: Purchased additional buttons
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly. As described. Package came with 2 adhesive stickers & button holders, two lengthy lanyards, batteries and has two ring/alarm options. We opted to hang them on the enclosed lanyards to increase their reach. SIGNAL ---In our case...the sound from the bell reaches all areas of our home (from an upstairs bedroom with solid wood closed door to all areas two story home). After determining it would meet our needs, we ordered additional call buttons. The buttons are lightweight. However, our dependent adult preferred not to wear the call button around his neck so, we ordered additional call buttons and placed one in the bathroom, by the chair-side, by the bedside &.in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: denise

customer_reviews.title: Peace of Mind
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews but my circumstance was a little different. My mother lives in a different home but next door. Would the call buttons still work that distance through walls? The cost was reasonable enough to take a chance so we purchased. My mother used it three times besides the testing we did and it worked each time. She was able to summon us when she fell and also when her phone wasn't working. She has one of those life line buttons but this was an additional level of security for her. I am very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Andera

customer_reviews.title: Recommend Product
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with entire transaction and product. Was concerned about it properly covering distance needed and I have no problem. My parents live on one side of house us on other and this is just what we needed for current health situation for them. Dad has peace of mind while Mom is gone and we have ability to carry on with daily activities around the house. Using the "doorbell" signal works best for us the "alarm" is exactly that alarming... Package came packed great and easy setup no issues. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect to link you to another person some distance (but ...
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect to link you to another person some distance (but in the same house) away. We live in a two story house. This Smart Caregiver enables my invalid husband to let me know when he needs help when I am out of earshot. We tried Walkie Talkies but their charge quickly runs out. This saves the day--and often the night for us. I've had it in use for over a month and it really works--it even summons me out of a deep sleep and that is invaluable to me!
customer_reviews.author: Lynette A. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: This product is great while it lasts. The first set that came, one of the call buttons would't work. Contacted the company and they sent a replacement. The replacement worked for about a month then both call buttons wouldn't work. We tried changing batteries and still wouldn't work. Very upsetting because my Father is paralyzed and couldn't use the call button at night when he needed to tell his caregiver he needed to use his urinal.
customer_reviews.author: JBailey

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay on your belt
customer_reviews.text: Great product, except that it kept falling off my belt, shattering on the floor and sending the cover and the batteries fly in all directions - until I added a nifty screw to the clip. See picture. The 2 tiny bumps are supposed to secure the device on your belt (red circles) but they DON'T. The screw (blue arrow) does it. Perhaps a redesign of the clip needs to be endeavored.
customer_reviews.author: Fred F.

customer_reviews.title: Ring a ling
customer_reviews.text: Perfect solution to being called from another part of the house. My sister had bought a cheap bell/ringer like what is at desks of hotels. If we were not in the room, we could not hear the ring. But this system is fabulous. There are two sounds to choose from: an ambulance type siren or a doorbell. It is easy for my 97 year old Mom to push the button and easy for us in our 60s with some diminished hearing to hear the call. She pushes the button and we jump! Nice to have the two call buttons for different parts of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Jo E Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!  Loud, works and great price!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ! Loud, easy, inexpensive, great device Found this while looking for an intercom system for my mom. They all had too many buttons and would confuse her! This is simple. Push the button. Both buttons have a lanyard and wall mount with adhesive or screw. The receiver box the attendant has cones with a belt clip or you can set it on a table. There is a ding-ding sound, or alarm (like a home alarm siren). Both are very loud and can easily wake you up. (If they don’t, nothing will). We have a large split home with mother in law suite, and the range works great from anywhere. This product is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: amharach

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: As an acupuncturist, I used this to help patients contact me while on the table. I think that WIFI, Bluetooth, and other wireless devices interfered with this device. Switched to a simple and affordable device called "the doorbell." Cost effective, weather proof, and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Qigong Guy

customer_reviews.title: Range was lousy. I would have had to have ...
customer_reviews.text: Range was lousy. I would have had to have been within sight and hearing distance of the person pushing the button...i.e., in mom's room standing next to her bed as opposed to being 75 feet down a hall in my room, to get the signal to work. sort of defeated the purpose of having it. Also appeared to be made much cheaper than the price would indicate it should have been made. Ended up throwing in trash.
customer_reviews.author: ehawkins

customer_reviews.title: Panic button ...
customer_reviews.text: We make use of these in our house as panic alarms. The kids' bedrooms are on the other side of the house and they have been taught to use these in the event of any type of emergency (e.g., fire, intruder, etc) where they need me to get over to them in a hurry. They have been attached to the side of a night table in each bedroom. Because we don't use them all the time, we periodically test to make sure they are still working ... no problems with batteries and such going bad so far from low use.
customer_reviews.author: Ben T

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT attach the holder for the alarm to the wall. AT ALL TIMES keep it on the alarm. The slightest jolt can result in the alarm coming apart and battery (which is difficult to install properly0 rendering it useless until the battery is re-inserted and the case put back together. Leaving the alarm in the holder prevents this disaster from happening. Also, be sure to order replacement batteries for back-up. I am returning as soon as the different alarm arrives. Need one that is sorta good until I receive the new one.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Works once then have to open round piece & readjust battery
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to open the round button piece and is very cheaply made inside. Battery isn’t securely held in place. Sometimes will work once then stops, have to re-open, gouging the plastic of one that is hard to open... ot reliable. My husband has ALS and really need someth8ng like this but THREW IT OUT... not reliable and needs to be.
customer_reviews.author: LuvAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Chimes randomly in the night
customer_reviews.text: This product needs to get two things right: It needs to chime reliably when the button is pressed, and not chime when the button is not pressed. Unfortunately ours has failed in the latter. Every few weeks it will randomly chime in the middle of the night when no one has pressed the button, waking us up. We live in the country a long ways from any neighbors so it cannot be interference. Nothing to do but get rid of it unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Nick H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for disabled child!
customer_reviews.text: Our son was in a horrible car accident that has left him disabled. We needed an easy way for him to call for help from other family members and this has worked out great! It's used multiple times a day and works every time. And because it comes with two call buttons, we can keep one in the bathroom and one using the lanyard on him. Seriously, it's fantastic and makes him feel a little better knowing he can get help any time right away. We love it! I enjoy answering email and writing reviews for products I buy off Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Pagers are a Seniors Best Friend!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I can’t hear each other when we are in different rooms of our home. We placed a pager button on my side of the bedpost, and we also have one in the master bath. The noise, or speaker part of the pager, is in the center of our home on the fireplace mantel and can be heard everywhere! If I am in bed and need to ask or tell my husband something, all I do is push a button, and he appears! Likewise, if I see a spider in the bathroom, all I need do is push a button, and my hero appears! It’s great! No more shouting with fruitless results!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stupid, cheap design and almost zero range
customer_reviews.text: Poorly designed and made of the cheapest plastic. The call buttons must be taken apart to install the batteries - and it's almost impossible to pry the plastic apart. I would not recommend this to anyone. Very frustrating, stupid design! Even more important is that the range is so poor that it wouldn't work in my very small, three-bedroom ranch house. If you're more than 20 feet away from the patient, it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Mémé

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: This item is okay but not great. The button is actually just the small green dot in the middle of the face. It can be difficult for an elderly person to find the sweet spot. Also the button has to be held down for a second or two for the pager to sound. The belt clip on the pager is very weak and it falls off of your belt very easily. The lanyard on the sending units are not adjustable for length. Overall just a so-so unit.
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: You'll definitely hear it.
customer_reviews.text: I think most people would not find this to be a detractment, but I only gave this product four stars because it is super loud. I put it next to my bedside and it startles me so bad when it goes off that I have to wait for the adrenaline rush to abate before going back to bed. I've tried putting it in a couple of socks to help deaden the noise. So I wish it had volume control for super light sleepers like me. Otherwise, it words really well (at quite a distance) and functions just like it should.
customer_reviews.author: Bleu

customer_reviews.title: Not quite 5 stars but...almost!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome alternative to a baby monitor for able adult or teen patients. I would have given them 5 stars but there are a few improvements that can be made to the product. 1. The 12 volt 21/23 batteries that go in the call buttons were dead on arrival. The only place I could find replacements is on Amazon (stores don't carry them). I bought Duracells. The only other negative is that you have to use a small flathead screwdriver to wedge open the call button case to replace the batteries. It works, but it takes a little coercing.
customer_reviews.author: Julie G.

customer_reviews.title: Works through walls
customer_reviews.text: We live in a side by side two family. This alarm works perfectly through all the walls. Cheap. Effective. Works exactly as designed. I bought two sets of alarms. Each set has two buttons, plus one alarm receiver. I use two buttons on the upper level, two buttons on the lower level. Make the alarm button a necklace, or give it a place by the bed. This system gives you many alarm choices. This system is so reasonably priced. Comes complete with batteries and the easiest of set up instructions. I am totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Arasellen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: My spouse had a fall and is temporarily restricted to using a wheel chair. She calls often and I don't always hear her which is frustrating to both of us. This solves that problem. During the day, we use the ding-dong setting which chirps just once, but at night I use the alarm setting which continues to wail until I turn it off. When I cut the lawns I can hear this over the engine noise and the range is about 250 feet. Wish I had found this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Family Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, as promised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom. Beyond what other reviewers have said, the batteries in the buttons are generic. I promptly replaced them with Duracells from my grocery stores. The units work perfectly, have good range, and are loud enough to hear easily but not so loud that you'll go deaf. Each button includes lanyards, screws to wall mount, and a piece of double sided foam tape to give you plenty of options. the labeling on the product is actually useful...the sound setting button for example actually says ding dong for that sound! I'd buy this again in a hearbeat. Excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: A. Tiwana

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I like the easy mobility this offers. Can carry the pager in my pocket or table and bring it outside while gardening. I leave it by the patio which is ok because it's still loud enough to hear from as far as the mail box. Having two help buttons is nice. I leave one wrapped around the bed rail and another by living room recliner. Before buying this, I relied on having my client to speed-dial call me or use "Alexa" to call me, but lately I havnt been recieving the calls which became frustrating. So a basic call button is perfect and no internet required :).
customer_reviews.author: Lorena H.

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and effective
customer_reviews.text: We have a 98 year old relative living semi independently. Of course she has a Home Alert that will dial 911 but our relative has a caregiver who lives close in the same building. For minor matters this works perfectly to get the caregiver to render assistance. It has been reliable, so far, we've had it a few months. Two buttons, one bedside, one next to her chair and the receiver for the caregivers apartment. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: zigzagg

customer_reviews.title: The perfect alarm for any handicapped person
customer_reviews.text: I, liked that fact that my handicapped brother is able to push a button and I am able to hear his call for help or assistance. Our bedrooms are on opposite ends and yet I can still hear and respond to his needs. This works great, can walk with the transmitter and still hear it outside 5 or 6 houses down. Highly recommend for any caregiver that can't always be in the house for every beck and call or may be asleep with the door closed.
customer_reviews.author: Kim L

customer_reviews.title: Use is 5 star Putting in battery is 1 star
customer_reviews.text: This product works well and is easy to use. It is like pressing a doorbell, that easy. Now the 1 star comes when you receive the call button, you need to install the batteries. The receiver is easy, the call buttons another story. The top of the button is soft plastic, the bottom is hard. When you put the screwdriver or whatever in the slot the top gives and you cannot open the top. Use your finger nails
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.text: My 90 year old mom had 2 strokes while having heart valve replacement. They said she needs a nursing home but our family didn't want that for her. We bought this product and this is by far the best purchase we've made. We put 1 button in her bed rail and the other in her walker. I keep the pager with me always. This has given me the piece of mind I needed to be able to leave her knowing she can call me if she needs anything. Easy to use, works great and has 2 ringer types. All you do is put the batteries in and you're good to go. Definitely at least 5 stars!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I got this so my mom could summon me from her living room even if I'm out working in the back yard. It works perfectly no matter where I am on the property. It's easy to clip on my belt loop or put in my pocket. It's also easy for my mom to operate; she only needs to push a button. Love this pager!!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my dad to use in addition to the audio/video baby monitor. The monitor needs to be full volume to do any good when he needs me right away. He used this within the first 24 hours and it got my attention. I had it on alarm but since have changed it to the doorbell mode so it doesn't scare the bejeezus out of me again. Great affordable option, I might purchase another. The only con I discovered was it's hard to open the button, without doing damage, to install the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Leitha S. Talmage

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my mom, so she can call us if she needs something. Because she fell a few months ago, we wanted her to have a way that she didn’t have to figure out how to make a phone call, but could just push a button. This works great, and the noise it makes is plenty loud that we can hear it from different areas of the house, and even from outside, as long as we don’t venture too far away (100 ft.)
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Alarm is very loud!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved the ease of unboxing and getting it ready! I hate both of the alarms. Neither one was appropriate for our needs! I’m using it as a way for my elderly mom to contact me when she needs me at night or if I’m out of range of hearing her! It’s perfect for that and very easy for her to use! The alarms or either a doorbell or loud alarm but it said that in the description!! So overall this is a great product!!
customer_reviews.author: LJ Davis

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Unit At Unbelievable Price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this since my spouse is coming home after cancer surgery and I wanted to make sure she could reach out to me if I was not in the room with her. The button is large enough to press easily and the unit I will keep with me sounds like a doorbell. This is certainly going to provide peace of mind for me. I don't how the battery life is so I'm going to get a spare set to have on hand. Battery installation was easy. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Drolma108

customer_reviews.title: Returned, didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Had to return this. My house is a tri-level. It didn't work. Then I saw the warning in the documentation that metal pipes and so forth can cause interference. Not sure how it is supposed to work from bathrooms. I didn't have the time to exchange for new one in case this one a one-off defective item. I had a very sick person to attend to. Instead I bough the InnoGear One Remote Call Button Wireless Caregiver Personal Pager Nurse Call Alert. Not as elegant, but sure got the job done for me.
customer_reviews.author: Liz H

customer_reviews.title: BEST EVER Caregiver Pager
customer_reviews.text: For nonpiercing, gentle awakening pager, this one is favulous. Flips to doorbell mode and is extra pleasant! Two receivers allows one to stay where you are headquartered, while you wear the other clipped on as you move about. Reasonably priced. When clients became unable to "hit" the center of the call button, I found that taping a hearing aid battery atop made it foolproof.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: My mom is getting on in years and I had to move in with her. She was concerned because I have a hearing loss and I don't always hear her call me. Her apartment is small, so I purchased this and I love it. She has a hospital bed and I used the sticky things to attach to the railing within her reach. The volume is very loud so I can hear it 🤗, this is a real lifesaver
customer_reviews.author: pwessy

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: This came in handy as I was trying to take care of my Mom after an illness. After she woke me up screaming one night I hoped on the internet and found this. My Master in on the other side of the house, so this was so easy for her to use to call me for help. Plus we kept the second one in her bathroom. It really helped both of us to rest better knowing she could call me with a press of the button.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy S - Arkansas

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Had a family member that was only partially independent. They needed privacy but also the opportunity to call others when they needed help. This was a great alternative to yelling. It worked well across a property with two houses next door to one another. The alarm feature is loud and has to be manually turned off on the receiver box. The "doorbell" function is nice for calling on someone to come help when it is not an emergency. I think this product gives great peace of mind and you get a lot for the price. I had a professional care taker ask me where I bought it because she wanted to recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: L.

customer_reviews.title: Ticked!
customer_reviews.text: I can't review this thing because the button pieces need an odd battery size; and although it said they were included, none came. I would have ordered them had I known. Feels like that brittle plastic. Went by reviews even though it was cheap. With Mom needing 24/7 care, and 3 of us-2 working, one not... We're trying to get into a rhythm here. Not receiving the batteries; looking for them; not finding them at 2 stores so far is upsetting... Will update when we get batteries...
customer_reviews.author: ScrappyKel

customer_reviews.title: Peace of Mind
customer_reviews.text: So far this system has worked excellent. I'm caregiver for an 80yo family member with cancer, mild dementia and incontinence. After a fall going to the bathroom in the middle of the night, I ordered this product. It has worked exceptional. We have a fairly large home and property. No problems if I'm out working in the yard, in the house or garage with this system registering calls when necessary. My only suggestion would be to make different sounds because one sounds like a doorbell and the other alarm type sound is terrifying. Other than that, money well spent for peac of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Z

customer_reviews.title: It HELPED.
customer_reviews.text: Okay. So, I have owned this product for 6 months and it still works... Or so I think. The Pager is about 50% work and 50% useless. She will push the button several times and I cannot hear it because of whatever reason unknown. Either the pager drains the batteries SUPER FAST or the product is already failing. If the latter, I would have hoped this product last for a few months more. In closing, I am not 100% confident that I will purchase this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Rumsford

customer_reviews.title: Best of Several Tried
customer_reviews.text: Liked this caregiver pager system best of several that I tried. Provides two call buttons which can be mounted or worn by the person. Pager portion is simple with only two choices of alert sounds; it is loud enough; it is small enough to fit in a pocket or clipped to a pocket or belt. Only negative is that the center button for the person to push on the call button is not sensitive enough for a person who is weak; my family member had a hard time to locate and push the button when in bed.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, 2 different sounds are a plus as is the fact that there are 2 different buttons!
customer_reviews.text: I like that this came with 2 call buttons, it is easy to use and works well for the distance I need it to. there are 2 different call noises it makes one is loud and irritating (would work well if you need to hear it over other stuff) the second call noise seems just right. I bought this for my parents, i have been helping with my father, he needs assistance at night, he has a whistle but I don't always hear it. I would recommend this product and but it again!!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Okay but not dependable
customer_reviews.text: Me and my wife are disabled and we had to move into a new house with stairs lucky The house had a room on the bottom of the stairs, well our 14 year old son couldn't hear use so I figured I would try this out at the beginning of testing this out it didn't work so I looked at the batteries and saw that the tab was wrong sorted that out and it's working however the range isn't the best maybe 100 feet tops but I wouldn't use this for elderly people at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: As a caregiver for my elderly mother, this is perfect and so easy for her to use. We looked at intercom systems that were way too complicated, this is as simple as a press of a button. She keeps one in her bed and wears the other around during the day, the volume is very loud (sometimes too loud, I actually wish the volume control had quieter options). Warning, it’s somewhat difficult to open to replace the battery. It requires prying it open with a flathead and a certain finesse so the plastic doesn’t break.
customer_reviews.author: Ann P.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product that Fits the Bill
customer_reviews.text: Just received today and tested in the house and the product is going to absolutely fill the bill! Works perfectly with the pager on the first floor and button unit in multiple areas of the 2nd level of our home. Easily heard as well. Ordered this to help provide "coverage" for a surgical patient recovering in our home. I'll know when assistance or something else is needed. Can't attest to the longevity of the product just yet, but for the price, it is absolutely fulfilling my needs at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Kandinsky9999

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit for Our Situation - Non-Emergency
customer_reviews.text: Needed something that could be used frequently throughout the day without "alarming" everyone. The softer tone is perfect. No need for external monitoring/emergency calling. Would be a nice option to have additional pagers to place around the house. From the Q&A, this is not possible from the same button even if you buy a second set. Taking the pager with you is workable and testing was successful throughout the entire house. The strap for the button makes it easier to grab/find.
customer_reviews.author: Sharpsburg

customer_reviews.title: Very Effective
customer_reviews.text: This product took the worry out of us being able to hear our dad calling for us. We were able to strap the unit to our belts or leave next to us in another room of his large house. We hung one of his buttons on his walker and one on his bed. Very effective and gave him his privacy and control in deciding when he really needed an assist. It has a good range too, we were able to go outdoors without worry.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a much valued previous model. A model I highly recommended to other caregivers I know. Previous model gave me a freedom to roam around the house knowing I would hear the call throughout. New version has a quieter/lower pitch. Hard to hear if the TV is loud. Absolutely cannot hear it from one room to another, making it necessary to carry on my person as I move through the house cleaning, cooking etc. This is not the same call button that received 5 stars. This is a sad replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just want we needed.
customer_reviews.text: We use this for our daughter that suffers from seizures. Most times she can feel them coming but it is usually just a few seconds and we don't know until we hear the convulsions from her room. Or sometimes she just doesn't feel right. Now when she is in her room, she or her sister can push the button and let us know. We have this for the overnight ours and it has helped us feel more secure in knowing what is going on. The alarm does sound like a door bell.
customer_reviews.author: SMAtlanta

customer_reviews.title: this is a good value
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something so my bedridden mom can contact me when I'm not within earshot. This works great. She pushes a button and an alarm goes off in the unit that I keep with me. Button is easy for her arthritic fingers to push, which is sometimes not the case. I would recommend this item to others looking for this kind of setup.
customer_reviews.author: AnneM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love this call button. It is perfect fir my mom who lives with me and is on hospice. If I’m in another area of my home I wouldn’t hear her if she tried to call out. She has used the button to call me and the alarm is loud. This is absolutely perfect.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly Collins

customer_reviews.title: I sent one to my mother and sister and they love it. ***Here is an alternative use
customer_reviews.text: This item can have many uses. I sent one to my mother and sister and they love it. ***Here is an alternative use: Say you have a pesky neighbor that won't let you enjoy your garage time? Have it in your pocket and press it. Then your wife calls your cell number and you say, "Gotta take this." Problem solved. A more practical application: Live in a questionable neighborhood? Your spouse gets home late? Have them activate the chime while they pull in the drive or parking space. You go out to meet them instead of them exiting the vehicle alone in the dark. etc
customer_reviews.author: San Diego

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother.
customer_reviews.text: The product never worked. Thank goodness my husband’s health improved and the call buttons were no longer necessary. By the time I got around to sending this item back, the return window had passed. Would have given no stars but that wasn’t an option!
customer_reviews.author: Lois

customer_reviews.title: Not great but not horrible
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my parents as they are living by themselves. The packaging felt very cheap and old. The product also did not feel like good quality, and the hook did not work well. For the price it didn’t feel worth it. The alarm was ok but not loud enough for 2 story house. Overall, not great but not horrible.
customer_reviews.author: VuuFam

customer_reviews.title: Has two ringers.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this when I came into the house from doing yardwork and found my wife had fallen. Hung one ringer low enough for her to easily reach it and other by her bed. It sounds like a doorbell, rings twice when button is pushed. I took the batteries out of my house wireless doorbell so I would not be mistaken. Visitors can knock. Solicitors can be ignored. Only wish it had a 600 foot range and it would be perfect. Still deserves 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: GEORGE FARQUHAR

customer_reviews.title: Very simple to use especially for the elderly.
customer_reviews.text: This works very well for my needs. I have my elderly parents in their 90s living with me in a 2-story home so it saves them from constantly physically getting up to call me. They just push the button to call me. I keep the pager near me at all times. It’s nice it comes with 2 call buttons too..we keep one in their bedroom and one in the family room where they spend most of their time. I work at home and my office is upstairs so it is a convenience.
customer_reviews.author: CTaps

customer_reviews.title: Works, but cheaply made and overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: Opening the round case to put in a battery is a chore because it's so cheaply made that you run the risk of breaking the case as you pry it open. As for the pager, it has a belt hook that doesn't work. The page constantly falls off. Also, the pager is too large and awkward. A smaller pager would be much better. The device works but, given the overall low quality, it's overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara L.

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this for a few months and so far it's great! My mom was able to alert me when she fell and couldn't get up. Now she uses it to page me during the night when she needs to use the restroom. It has 2 different sounds - an on-going alarm or a one-time "ding-dong". There are 2 call buttons and one receiver. You cannot beat it for the low price!
customer_reviews.author: BigJ

customer_reviews.title: Peace of Mind
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for use with my elderly 86yr old mother. She has a metal bell, but this is much easier to use and much more likely to wake me if there is an emergency. She keeps one of the buttons attached to her headboard, and one with her on her walker. It gives me a lot of peace of mind and is a bargain for the price. I'd recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Rahlan

customer_reviews.title: Very good but alarm tone could be improved
customer_reviews.text: Really perfect for what I need. One thing that could be improved would be the 2 alarm tones. You either have a doorbell sound or something that sounds like an air raid siren. And I don’t see a volumn control either. Other than that the range is good and they work, overall I’m pleased.
customer_reviews.author: LisaG

customer_reviews.title: Keep extra batteries on hand and test it often, it works great
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I suggest keeping backup batteries on hand. I have mine on the chime setting, the siren is just too weird. Once they press it it automatically gives you two notifications. Keep the pager unit with you, and be sure your patient or loved one knows how to use the button. Do a daily test to make sure it’s working and not low in batteries. This is invaluable if you are caring for anyone elderly or with disabilities. Good coverage throughout our house and yard.
customer_reviews.author: SnowbirdTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: The range is only 150 feet
customer_reviews.text: Here's a horror story: My loved-one (LO) lives in a small assisted living home. Total of 16 residents on two levels. My loved-one is on the ground floor, nearest to the kitchen, dining and community rooms. My LO fell out of bed. The call button was employed, and employed, and employed -- for three hours. Finally my LO had to call 9-1-1 from the cell phone, to be gotten off the floor. Because the call button did not alert the care staff. Don't underestimate how short 150 feet is.
customer_reviews.author: B/K Bakers

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in This One
customer_reviews.text: The door bell tone that I use with this pager sounds flat, dead, and tinny compared to the same version of this product I purchased in Jan 17. The system works but the sound generating components are degraded so that the tone is now somewhat muted and irritating. My old system still works so it is easy to compare. The product packaging is flimsy and it was shipped in a padded but flexible envelope, so maybe the pager was damaged during shipping. But I really believe that it just more cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Active Al

customer_reviews.title: This pager really works!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Live this! It gives me so much peace of mind knowing my elderly mom can notify me if she needs when I'm outside or at the other end of the house... wasn't sure if she could page me from 300 feet away, but yes, she can. Great product at any price, but the price was very reasonable as well! Highly recommend! Packaging is just plain dumb tho.... says it provides fall prevention and prevents wandering!! I was expecting a human to pop out of the box!! This pager won't do that!!!
customer_reviews.author: tina

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My mother needs to call us for assistance. We were using a desk bell in her bedroom and her bathroom. This was difficult to hear if there was additional room noise where we were and we couldn't go outside and hear this at all. We switched to the call button and pager which allows us much more freedom since we can carry the pager with us. For us, it even works when we're outside in the yard. Daytime the noise level is fine, but I turn the pager speaker side down on a carpeted floor next to my bed at night and it still has enough volume to wake me. I wish we had purchased this earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia F.

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made-arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: One of the buttons arrived broken-the battery terminal was loose and fell off when I opened cover. I cannot return it because I need the functional button for my patient to use immediately. One button is better than none. The unit is very poorly made-you definitely get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Roberge

customer_reviews.title: This works great. I live on a acre property
customer_reviews.text: This works great. I live on a acre property. I am able to leave the push button call in the house and go all the way to the end of my acre (outside) and the alarm works. My husband and I tested it out the first day I got it. As others have said in their review.....if you need to go farther the alarm is very very loud. So you can set down the alarm pager and walk away from it if you need to be farther away because you can hear the alarm loud and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Esther Judd

customer_reviews.title: My review of this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I love this caregiver pager. I live with and take care of my elderly mother. Now, she can call me easily when we are both home in case of an emergency. I use the alarm ringer and not the ding dong ringer bc the alarm feature is louder and continuous until you turn it off, so it will eventually get your attention if you are within earshot. I also love the pocket clip.
customer_reviews.author: NightOwl

customer_reviews.title: Works well in large apartment.
customer_reviews.text: Works well between distant rooms in a large (2200 sq ft) apartment. Batteries in the receiver are standard, easy to replace, while batteries in the sending units, though exotic, seem to be long-lived.. When batteries need to be replaced, so far it has been the standard cells that have failed. Two settings are available in the receiver, a non-intrusive "ding -dong", or a more demanding "emergency" sound. .My wife has one of these pendants hanging on her walker, and this arrangement has proved very convenient on several occasions.The ding-dong is loud enough to rouse me from my sleep in another room.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Best investment I have made in a long time.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have heard about this sooner. My wife just got out of the hospital from a back fracture procedure and is in for a long recovery. I was talking to my neighbor whose caring for her 102 year old mother and she reccomended I get one of these. I did and it works great. I can go outside and not have to run in and out to make sure she is okay.
customer_reviews.author: Clubmaker 2003

customer_reviews.title: great call system
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my parents and they are so pleased with product. They were not ready for direct access to 911 yet but feel safer with this on hand. When the button on the necklace is pushed, either an alarm will sound or a chime (you get to choose). Product arrived quickly and well packaged. Price was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: Range is about as far as you can yell
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in case my mom fell while in the shower. When she did fall, the range was not in reach of my base unit. Luckily, it was only 10 minutes until I checked on her and found her on the floor. She said she was pushing the button several times but I received nothing on the other side of the house. My suggestion is pay a little more and get the longest range you can find. Your loved ones are worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Okay system
customer_reviews.text: Caregiving disabled husband. Batteries died after five weeks since it needs to be On. Replaced batteries. At first I thought the unit was dead- no response.I looked at the ringer selection and found it OFF. Must have slid to Off from Chime selection. Works great again! The call button battery area could have been a better design. I use a small, flat screwdriver in the notch to pop the call button case open, Unit would be super with an AC adapter.
customer_reviews.author: N.

customer_reviews.title: More what I need than a remote monitoring system
customer_reviews.text: All I really need is a call bell my husband can hear when he's in another room. This it it. The standard bell is audible to his limited hearing, and the louder alarm works even when he's using bluetooth>>hearing aids sound from tv.
customer_reviews.author: MaggieM

customer_reviews.title: Thank you
customer_reviews.text: These helped make sure that my grandmother was always able to get care immediately at all hours of the the day and night. If I said they were a valuable tool that would be an absolute understatement. They were absolutely neccessary to enable us in regards to enabling us to make my grandmother's last days as comfortable as possible. I thank you very much for giving me access to such an important and effective product.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron McLain

customer_reviews.title: Godsend for home caregivers of mobility-impaired patients
customer_reviews.text: This little pager was immensely helpful during the last weeks of my father's life. He had severe COPD and could not call out for me very loudly, besides which my hearing is a a little impaired. With the pager he knew that he could call for me wherever I was in the house and I would hear the chime and come immediately. The pager responded wherever I was in the house. I did not test the range scientifically, but we have a 6-bedroom home and it appeared to work in every area.
customer_reviews.author: Tan A. Summers

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what I need it to do
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so my mom can let me know when she needs me. She spends most time in bed and I have a bit of hearing problem so when she needs me she just pushes the button instead of calling, works great! IF... I had to improve one thing, it would be to make the button on the caller a bit bigger and to stand out a little more or maybe have a bit of glow in the dark for those more elderly. All in all this is a great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Hope Wilson

customer_reviews.title: One button doesn't work........
customer_reviews.text: When I received this, one of the call buttons didn't work. I exchanged it for another set, but the same thing. I've tried everything, including using different batteries. I would love to know if this is resolvable, and/or if anyone else has experienced this issue. I am going to keep the set because we only really NEED one working button, but I wish both would work as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Not dependable
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was great at first. But now we test it every once in a while and it's VERY undependable. It won't even sound the alarm from the other side of the house. You have to get close for the alarm to sound. What good is that if your elderly parent/grandparent needs help?!
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Mungus

customer_reviews.title: I am now able to go out in yard and work I marked how far I can go and it works great. I like having 2 receivers leave one on ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife who has aphasia and in wheelchair has been been using for 6 months. rings me anytime she needs anything. I am now able to go out in yard and work I marked how far I can go and it works great. I like having 2 receivers leave one on bed and she wears or straps to chair if Im busy. Dislikes I wish it was rechargeable but have only put in one set of batteries in six months so thats pretty good
customer_reviews.author: FRANK

customer_reviews.title: batteries can die suddenly with no warning, stranding your patient.
customer_reviews.text: No battery life indicator becomes a really big deal when the patient is pressing the button and the pager has suddenly lost power with no warning. Recommend changing the batteries once every 10 days just to be safe. YOU WILL NEED A BACK UP SYSTEM! also it is too easy for the on/off switch on the pager to be accidentally turned off. I recommend paying more for (if possible) a better system. Good thing about it is that it is simple for everybody to use and operate and nonadjustabley loud.
customer_reviews.author: MotoMikeRyder

customer_reviews.title: Works great with new batteries. Don’t trust the ones that come with it as ours were dead on arrival. Works great with new ones.
customer_reviews.text: Works as described but had to replace batteries as the ones included did not work at all. Once new batteries went in, it was fully functional. We’ve only been using it a few days and the only flaw we have noticed is the fact that the call button is a bit small which makes it difficult for consumer to not only find the button, but to press it as well. It’s been tested and works well over 300 feet and reaches through walls and such. Batteries are not all that expensive to replace. I paid less than $4 for two of the tiny ones that go in the call button. It’s a great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The call buttons worked very well. They were used ...
customer_reviews.text: The call buttons worked very well. They were used after my father had a fall and needed some extra help. We placed one button where it could be reached from his bed and the second one next to the shower. (He wore a medical alert necklace, so this one was not worn around the neck, but that is possible.) The receiver was at the other end of the apartment and the signal was received around a corner and through closed doors. I would estimate the distance was about 70 feet.
customer_reviews.author: KL in AZ

customer_reviews.title: These are really great. I tried a different system and it was ...
customer_reviews.text: These are really great. I tried a different system and it was just too complicated for my 90yr old mom to remember and had a good deal of static. This is simple , efficient and loud. I have one hanging in the bathroom if she needs help. One on her bedside table . The box that alarms has a clip so you can wear it or just put it near you . It also has 2 sounds ( a door bell and an alarm) Woke me up out of a dead sleep once .. So works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind that I will hear the alarm when help is needed
customer_reviews.text: Can hear this alarm throughout our 3500 sq ft home which is what we needed. Two call buttons so one can go in the bedroom and the other in the bathroom. Easy to install, I used self-sticking velcro to adhere the buttons and the monitor so they can be easily moved.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie M.

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work but big
customer_reviews.text: The call button is about twice the thickness of a life alert type lanyard button so it's not as user friendly from that standpoint. Also, the lanyards supplied are just right for 6' tall people and are not adjustable near as I can tell. We had to tie a knot to have it fit our mother. Update - really does not work well for elderly person to wear on lanyard due to its size.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kraft

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is great! I live downstairs from my elderly mother. She can page me anytime she needs me. It gives her a good sense of security and me the freedom to be anywhere around the house including the garage and outside. Very easy to set up. Construction and design look good. I bought two so that we could have extra transmitters in the bathroom near the floor and one hanging from the bed headboard. A great product!
customer_reviews.author: Sky King

customer_reviews.title: call button
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my dad to use. It is perfect, we can hear this throughout the house when he needs help
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Jennings

customer_reviews.title: It sounds like a door bell
customer_reviews.text: Came with 2 big buttons, one Lanyard to wear beeper around neck and a pager. Necklace looks bulky but not very heavy. It sounds like a door bell. So she pushed the button and the aid get the doorbell sound on her pager and she then knows she needs here. Works well for us. However, sometime the client get's inpatient and keeps hitting the button over and over and over....lol
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L

customer_reviews.title: Suitable for purpose at affordable price
customer_reviews.text: When my mother-in-law came home from hip surgery she needed assistance getting in and out of bed. This was a simple affordable call method which worked fine. The only downside is that it would be better if it had a volume control. I only used the chime function but it would have been nice to have the volume lower so I could hear it but it would not wake my husband..
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Handy, easy to use and hear call button for a million uses
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for anyone debilitated, recovering from a surgery, or just sick in bed. I just needed it for my husband recovering from a surgery. Saved him from trying to get my attention from the other room. Cheap but very effective
customer_reviews.author: Marge

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: My mom is disabled. She is bedridden and she lost her vision so I decided to buy this to help her when she needs attention to us. She is using this and she is very happy. Using this for a day and it really helps her. I hope the quality is good. The only issue is my Mom needs to have a little force to press the button. She has a weak hand though.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Great for its purpose
customer_reviews.text: This product is great for what it's made for! My only complaint is there's no volume control and it jolts me out of my sleep. I recently covered it with a few things to tone down the alert. But my mother loves it and it works well for her to notify me during the night if she needs something.
customer_reviews.author: CharATX

customer_reviews.title: Very very good
customer_reviews.text: I woodwork in my garage so the noise of my different tools are quite loud. I wanted this for when my 86 year old mom is alone in her duplex next door. Even when the table saw and dust collector running I can hear the call. I am very please with it. I have a question though. When I am not in the garage I would like to have another unit in my house, also next door. I wonder if one button would ring both units. If anyone knows please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: The best ever. I care for my 95 year old ...
customer_reviews.text: The best ever. I care for my 95 year old blind mother. This has taken away her fears of being alone or in need. It has a nice door bell chime or loud alarm which I use for night time. She has it on the lanyard and I have the other stationed in the bathroom. This took away her fear of being alone. Great range I can even be outside gardening. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Great for mental disability care giving!
customer_reviews.text: My son with Autsim has the master bedroom down the hall and I cant always hear everything. He knows now that he can press a button to get me right away!! Hes used it a couple of times. Its great!!
customer_reviews.author: Juliana

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: We got so if my 80 year old mother needed us she could push the button. She ended up using when she wasn't able to get to a phone and call me or the intercom & it was a life saver. We had to call 911 and the ambulance took her to the hospital for emergency surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Myra Louise Vermillion

customer_reviews.title: Fall-risk solution
customer_reviews.text: I have a family member who is a fall risk. We've mitigated those as much as possible, but they wear this button just in case. We test from different locations in the house weekly to make sure that it's working. I have been very impressed with the range - we have not found a location in the house where the signal doesn't work, including the detached garage on the lot next door.
customer_reviews.author: NWA Dad

customer_reviews.title: Affordable peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: I needed an emergency call button for my elderly mother who lives in the same house. I put one on her nightstand and one in the shower. They work great and help her keep her independence while giving me some peace of mind! There's no volume control, but it's loud enough.
customer_reviews.author: MatteoPhx

product_meta.title: Smart Caregiver Two Call Buttons & Wireless Caregiver Pager
product_meta.description:
Size:White/GreenThe TL-5102TP Two Pendant Paging System comes with two nurse Call Buttons and one Caregiver Pager. The Caregiver Pager has two audible alarms to choose from and can be carried in a pocket or clipped to a belt. with the press of a button the resident is able to alert caregiver. The range between the pendant and pager is 300 feet. Batteries Included.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The TL-5102TP Two Pendant Paging System comes with two nurse Call Buttons and one Caregiver Pager. The Caregiver Pager has two audible alarms to choose from and can be carried in a pocket or clipped to a belt. with the press of a button the resident is able to alert caregiver. The range between the pendant and pager is 300 feet. Batteries Included.
feature_bullets: Allows both caregiver and resident freedom while still calling for help at the touch of a button
Pager and call buttons are easy to use

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,840 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
